did.unittitle: Capital District Regional Planning Commission Records
did.abstract: This collection documents the comprehensive planning work of New York's Capital District Regional Planning Commission across several decades.
did.physloc: The materials are located onsite in the department.

scopecontent.head: Content Description
scopecontent.p: The collection contains plans; proposals; maps; reports; studies; booklets on codes, regulations, and zoning laws; and correspondence. The materials discuss plans for cities and counties in New York's Capital Region as well as the Adirondacks.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: The Capital District Regional Planning Commission (CDRPC) is a regional planning and resource center, established pursuant to New York State law, serving Albany, Rensselaer, Saratoga, and Schenectady counties. CDRPC was created in 1967 by a cooperative agreement amongst these four counties. Its original purpose was to perform and support comprehensive planning work, including surveys, planning services, technical services, and the formulation of plans and policies to promote coordinated development of the entire Capital Region. Over time, the mission of the CDRPC evolved in response to changes in the needs of the Capital Region, funding sources, organizational structures, and information technology. While continuing to provide a wide variety of comprehensive planning services, CDRPC has also assumed the functions of Data and Information Center, Economic Development District, Foreign-Trade Zone Administrator, Climate Smart Communities Coordinator, and Water Quality Manager.

arrangement.head: Arrangement of the Collection
arrangement.p: The collection is unprocessed and is likely disorganized. Individual items may be difficult to find.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Mark A. Castiglione, executive director, Capital District Regional Planning Commission, donated all materials in this collection to the M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives in July 2019.
